title: GPU is being used, even with --cuda disabled
body:
I tried evaluating the QM9 dataset with `--cuda`, but the following error is produced. Training with `--cuda` works fine though. Is it possible to use a GPU on a different device?

```
$ spk_run.py train schnet qm9 ./database.db ./model --split 100 100 --cuda

...

INFO:root:...training done!

$ spk_run.py eval database.db model --split test --cuda

INFO:schnetpack.data.atoms:The dataset has already been downloaded and stored at ./database.db
INFO:root:create splits...
INFO:root:load data...
INFO:root:loading trained model...
INFO:root:evaluating...

/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/data/atoms.py:327: UserWarning: The given NumPy array is not writeable, and PyTorch does not support non-writeable tensors. This means you can write to the underlying (supposedly non-writeable) NumPy array using the tensor. You may want to copy the array to protect its data or make it writeable before converting it to a tensor. This type of warning will be suppressed for the rest of this program. (Triggered internally at  /pytorch/torch/csrc/utils/tensor_numpy.cpp:180.)
  properties[pname] = torch.FloatTensor(prop)
/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ase/atoms.py:967: VisibleDeprecationWarning: Use get_global_number_of_atoms() instead
  warnings.warn('Use get_global_number_of_atoms() instead',
/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/data/atoms.py:327: UserWarning: The given NumPy array is not writeable, and PyTorch does not support non-writeable tensors. This means you can write to the underlying (supposedly non-writeable) NumPy array using the tensor. You may want to copy the array to protect its data or make it writeable before converting it to a tensor. This type of warning will be suppressed for the rest of this program. (Triggered internally at  /pytorch/torch/csrc/utils/tensor_numpy.cpp:180.)
  properties[pname] = torch.FloatTensor(prop)
/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ase/atoms.py:967: VisibleDeprecationWarning: Use get_global_number_of_atoms() instead
  warnings.warn('Use get_global_number_of_atoms() instead',

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 124, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 90, in main
    evaluate(
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/utils/script_utils/evaluation.py", line 31, in evaluate
    results += evaluate_dataset(metrics, model, loaders[datasplit], device)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/utils/script_utils/evaluation.py", line 49, in evaluate_dataset
    result = model(batch)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 1051, in _call_impl
    return forward_call(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/atomistic/model.py", line 41, in forward
    inputs["representation"] = self.representation(inputs)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 1051, in _call_impl
    return forward_call(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/representation/schnet.py", line 215, in forward
    x = self.embedding(atomic_numbers)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 1051, in _call_impl
    return forward_call(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/sparse.py", line 158, in forward
    return F.embedding(
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/nn/functional.py", line 2043, in embedding
    return torch.embedding(weight, input, padding_idx, scale_grad_by_freq, sparse)
RuntimeError: Expected all tensors to be on the same device, but found at least two devices, cpu and cuda:0! (when checking arugment for argument index in method wrapper_index_select)
```
